For-loop_key3: When this `loop` runs the first time, the value of i is 0, 0<3 is `true`, and it is incremented due to i++, i value will become 1, therefore i is printed
For-loop_key4: When this `loop` runs the second time, the value of i is 1, 1<3 is `true`, and it is incremented due to i++,i value will become 2, therefore i is printed
For-loop_key5: When this `loop` runs the third time, the value of i is 2, 2<3 is `true`, and it is incremented due to i++,i value will become 3, therefore i is printed
For-loop_key6: When this `loop` runs the fourth time, the value of i is 3. Clearly, 3<3, so the for `loop` will stop.
For-loop_key7: When we are using a for `loop`, we can in one line initialize the `variable`, give the condition, and increment or decrement the `variable`. For `loop` runs for a specific number of times.
